name: Poison Components
description: Carefully prepared botanical and mineral substances for creating various poisons. Ostensibly for pest control or medicinal purposes, but primarily used for more nefarious ends.

historicalNotes.historicalSignificance: Poison was the subtle weapon of choice in Renaissance Venice's political intrigues. The Republic's position as a trade hub gave it access to exotic toxic substances from around the world. The Council of Ten even maintained its own official poisoners for state-sanctioned eliminations of enemies, though this was never publicly acknowledged.
notableCases: The mysterious death of Doge Giovanni Bembo in 1618
The poisoning of the Cypriot ambassador in 1543
